thread.title: ‘Refugees Welcome’ Banner Unfurled At Statue Of Liberty
thread.title_full: ‘Refugees Welcome’ Banner Unfurled At Statue Of Liberty

author: CBS Dallas / Fort Worth
title: ‘Refugees Welcome’ Banner Unfurled At Statue Of Liberty
text:
TRAFFIC : Overturned Semi Has I-35E South CLOSED Between Riverfront and Colorado Blvd. ‘Refugees Welcome’ Banner Unfurled At Statue Of Liberty February 22, 2017 5:31 AM 
Follow KRLD: Facebook | Twitter 
NEW YORK (AP) – The National Park Service is trying to figure out who unfurled a giant banner at the Statue of Liberty saying “Refugees Welcome.” 
Park Service spokesman Jerry Willis says the 3-by-20-foot banner was hung from the public observation deck at the top of the statue’s pedestal Tuesday afternoon. The banner was taken down more than an hour later. "Refugees welcome": National Park Service tries to figure out who unfurled giant banner at Statue of Liberty https://t.co/A56GRPumjv pic.twitter.com/FIIIX8EGiZ 
— CBS News (@CBSNews) February 22, 2017 
Willis says regulations prohibit anything fixed to the statue. 
The stunt happened the day the Department of Homeland Security announced expanded immigration enforcement policies.
